snippet: Farouk al-Shara, 74, vice president and loyal disciple of President Bashar al-Assad, would almost certainly become temporary president under an Arab League peace proposal.
abstract: Pres Bashar al-Assad's loyal disciple and Vice President Farouk al-Shara would almost certainly become the temporary president of Syria, under the Arab League peace proposal.

byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz contributed reporting from Moscow. Toby Lyles contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Farouk al-Shara, 74, vice president and loyal disciple of President Bashar al-Assad, would almost certainly become temporary president under an Arab League peace proposal.

headline.seo: Waiting in the Wings, a Survivor of Three Decades of Syrian Politics
